intro: Lonchitis isaloensis, commonly known as the Isalo endemic plant, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
